divs: Sighting DetailsFirst of all.... this isn't much of a sighting. A distant 'light in the sky' doesn't seem too significant. I am a member and my reason for saying anything about it is to see if anyone else may have reported anything like what I saw. I heard from friends that the Philly news stations said something about 'sightings' but said it was, I believe, a meteor! I was lying in bed watching tv. I rolled over. When I roll to my right I can look out my window. I live out in the country. Across the street is nothing but open fields. I look out to the east. There is often a lot of air traffic out there at night. I am often amazed at how some nights looking out, I may see 3 or 4 or even 5 airplanes at any given time. Well, on this wednesday night when I looked out I saw a very bright 'star'. It was a little larger appearing than any other star. Maybe the size a planet sometimes appears. I can't say how far away it was.... but, it appeared to me to be far away. It appeared approximately 30 degrees up from the horizon. It appeared motionless. I wanted to be certain that it wasn't just a plane. Now I was curious. After a short time it moved quickly 'up'! It moved up a distance and then stopped again. Then it moved in a zig-zag up and down about 3 or 4 times. Then it did it all over again. And then.... it just 'went out' It disappeared. I kept watching but nothing happened. And..... that's it!
trends: There have been 12 other sightings in Quakertown
There were no other sightings in Quakertown on or around January 13th 2010
